content.description: Crimp line to the right of greasy kid stuff.
content.location: kid stuff boulder, beside Greasy kid stuff.

content.description: Start in the horizontal crack just right of Warm Up Roof.  Move through a powerful undercling into a right hand pinch.  Set your feet and throw to the undercling shared with Warm Up Roof.  Match and continue up Warm Up Roof.
content.location: Start 5ft right of the obvious right leaning flake that is Warm Up Roof.

content.description: Start low on the obvious flake and then climb up through big moves to good holds at the top.
Left and right underclings under the roof, then throw for the lip.  Watch the swing then make a big reach to gain the face and top out
content.location: Left side of Warm Up Roof

content.description: Start on the "trailer hitch" hold and a foot out right power through hard to hold pinches and slap your way to the angled jug.  Most people drop off from here, but for full value do the top out.  The feet are choss, but as long as your track hands and feet you'll be fine.  3 stars for awesome holds, powerful movement and a fine landing.  -1 stars for being a drop off or for the chossy highball top out.
content.protection: 2-3 pads.  Spotters if you're going to do the top out.
content.location: From the warm up boulder turn around and head back toward the approach the boulder is on your left before you go through the passage way that has Slashface.  Mojo is on the left side of this boulder.

content.description: The start hold is a horizontal pinch at head height with a good thumb catch on the bottom. There are many ways of doing this boulder so find the way that works best for you.
content.location: This is located on the same wall as Warm Up Roof. It is the stand start to Li V13. Its a few feet right of the Warm Up Roof.

content.description: Located far to the right of Warm Up Roof.  Start on a big low flake and move up and right to a scary and sharp flake.
Low start on big slopers and work your way up through a few good holds to a big reach to some sharp crimps to an easy topout.
content.location: Southeast of the Warmup Wall facing the opposite direction, overlooking the Dragon's Den.  "Greasy Kid Stuff" is the chalked sloper problem in the middle of the wall.

content.description:
Given V4 in the guide book, seems harder. 

  Start just right of The Guillotine. Move out from the horizontal onto a sloping left facing rail. A big move out to a good edge at the lip. Figure out what to do with this and make a loooong reach up to  horizontal and an easier top out.
content.location: This problem is near the left end of the main group of problems. Just right of The Guillotine.

content.description: "Start on jugs at the left side. Go up to two crimps and then up to a hueco and a loose finish."
content.location: On Lower Terrace below Warm Up Roof on the same level as Slashface. The climb is downhill a couple hundred feet from Slashface and Jogger.Â

content.description: Crimp route on kid stuff wall. It is next to juvenile offender.
content.location: The right most crimp problem on kid stuff wall. Same start as adolescent behavior.

content.description: Climb out roof right of Crispy Critters. Start in break above the sotol, climbing up the prominent brown rock. Top out up and to the right.
content.location: Right of Crispy Critters, left of Warm Up Roof in the middle of the wall.

content.description:
This unaesthetic problem requires good body tension, and confidence on poor slopers.   

  Start sitting with your hands in some very smooth scoops.  Pull off the ground and fire for a strange sloper/pinch feature.  Either campus or use heel hooks to move left to a decent spot in a huge hueco.  Throw in a kneebar and make a few more large lock offs between good holds, and escape right on friable rock.  

  Easy on the skin.
content.protection: Two pads.  The kneebar is so good you don't need a pad.

content.description:
Warm-up Roof and Kids Stuff wall which sit back to back one facing N and the other facing S used to be a very popular area to warm up. Proximity to the campground and pond parking was good, then people could move on to the Dragon's Den or the Dark Heart from there. The Warm-up roof has good problems in the V2 to V5 range pulling on steep jugs out a 60 degree wall while Kids Stuff wall has a small low roof and a short vertical wall, most of the problems are shorter and some easier stuff as well. Pretty much all the problems are at least OK with Warm-up Roof being the stand out, Guillotine is also quite good. In recent years some very difficult problems have been added to the Warm-up Roof side of things, especial if you consider Slashface and Superfuz part of the area. 

  A great place to warm up before moving on to the Dragon's Den.
